revised_title: Anatomical Study of Female Organs and Placenta in the Raccoon
tldr: This article presents an anatomical description of the female organs and placenta of the raccoon. It discusses the similarities and differences between the raccoon and other carnivores in terms of placental structure and the absence of an umbilical vesicle. The study contributes to the understanding of reproductive systems in the animal kingdom.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
